keyTakeAways: India has rejected claims by US President Donald Trump that it agreed to stop buying Russian oil.
India maintains that it has no knowledge of any assurance from Prime Minister Narendra Modi to cease Russian oil imports.
India is a major importer of Russian oil, with state-owned refiners like Indian Oil Corporation increasing purchases, indicating ongoing dependency.
India's refusal to comply with US pressure is seen as a demonstration of its foreign policy autonomy and strong leadership.
The US has imposed tariffs on India (25% initially, plus additional 25%) in response to Russian oil imports, creating economic friction.
India emphasizes energy security and diversification, stating stable prices and secure supply are central to its energy policy.
The issue reflects broader geopolitical tensions, with India maintaining close ties with Russia and planning to host Russian President Vladimir Putin in the coming months.
India's foreign ministry and officials, including S. Jaishankar, acknowledge trade disputes with the US but emphasize active diplomatic efforts to resolve them.

summaryOfNewsArticle: US President Donald Trump claimed that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi had assured him India would stop importing Russian oil, a claim India strongly denies. India’s foreign ministry states it has no knowledge of such a conversation, emphasizing its energy policy is based on stability, diversified sourcing, and meeting market demands. India remains a major buyer of Russian oil, with state-owned refiners like Indian Oil Corporation increasing purchases. Experts note the scale of imports and differences in crude quality make a sudden shift impractical. The situation highlights a broader geopolitical tension between the US and India, with India asserting its sovereignty and diplomatic independence, especially in energy and foreign policy. Despite US-imposed tariffs, India continues its energy partnerships with Russia and plans to host Russian President Vladimir Putin, signaling deepening ties with Moscow.
title: India Denies US Claim It Agreed to Stop Buying Russian Oil
